results.title: Cloud Frontend Engineer (ES)
results.description:
Signaloid provides efficient computing hardware and software technologies to quantify, transmit, and track data uncertainty in computations on empirical data. Our technologies are used in applications including materials modeling, autonomous systems, computational finance, machine learning, and noisy intermediate-scale quantum computing. Our team consists of contrarian engineers with combined research, engineering, and leadership experience from Apple, ARC, ARM, Bell Labs, CMU, University of Cambridge, EPFL, IBM Research, Max Planck, MIT, and NEC Labs. Find out more at https://signaloid.com and try out the Signaloid uncertainty-tracking computing platform by signing up for free at https://get.signaloid.io.

Â 

Role Description

In this role, you will:

  • Lead the implementation of new front-end functionality of the Signaloid Cloud Developer Platform
  • Be responsible for extending the testing and QA infrastructure of the Signaloid Cloud Developer Platform
  • Be responsible for formulating your own objectives to deliver on company-wide objectives and key results
  • Be responsible for taking the initiative to identify whether the quality level of your implementation meets both explicit and implicit design and quality objectives of the team

Requirements

  • Undergraduate or masters degree in computer engineering, computer science, or a related discipline

  • Experience working on full-stack applications collaborating with backend engineers
  • Ability to design clean, intuitive and pixel-perfect user interfaces
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Good design sensibilities
  • A willingness to listen to people until they feel understood
  • Honesty, empathy, and a willingness to see the world from the viewpoint of others

Additional Desirable Skills and Experience:

  • Experience working at a pre-seed round software startup
  • Experience with GraphQL
  • Experience with responsive and accessible design
  • Understanding of SEO principles.
  • Experience working with UX/UI/Product designers
  • Knowledge of good CI/CD practices
  • Experience deploying cloud applications
  • Experience developing full stack applications
  • Experience with interface design tools (e.g., Figma, Canva, Adobe XD)
  • Experience in Test-Driven Development

Â 

Our Recruiting Procedure
  • All positions require you to write a one-page cover letter. We use this to screen for communication skills, as clear communication is essential in a remote working environment.
  • Applicants who pass the cover letter screening receive an initial 15-minute Zoom screening call with a member of our People Development Team to discuss your CV.
  • Applicants who pass the screening interview, regardless of the position you are interviewing for, will be given a real-world project to solve over the course of one week (or two weeks if there are currently employed in a full-time job). In exchange for your time, we give you two books relevant to the rest of the interview process and Â£500 worth of free credits on the Signaloid Cloud Developer Platform.
  • Applicants who successfully complete the project are invited for a set of one-hour interviews with people from our core teams (there will be up to six such interviews) which will use the project you completed as a discussion point.
  • In the final stage, applicants are invited for an on-site interview with members of the team in Cambridge.

Benefits

You will get to see your work very quickly deployed in products used by people in the real world, including:

  • Signaloid Cloud Developer Platform
  • Signaloid Cloud Computing Engine
  • Signaloid Hardware Modules

A flexible remote-first work environment

  • Be part of an international team with the flexibility to choose where you live
  • You can work any set of eight hours in a day provided four of those hours overlap with the working day in Zurich
  • Join the rest of the team every three months for an in-person session somewhere in Europe

Competitive compensation

  • All roles pay in the top decile of similar roles in London, adjusted for the OECD cost of living in your chosen domicile country
  • Yearly bonus based on company's Objectives and Key Results (OKR) performance and bi-yearly bonus based on your project team's OKR performance
  • Simple transparent compensation across the company, with four pay levels, in all roles, based on skill level: Contributor, Senior Contributor, Lead Contributor, and Principal Contributor
  • All full-time employees receive attractive stock options package

A driven but respectful environment

  • Our motto is "We're all going to die": We never speak ill of others even if we differ in our viewpoints; we show up every day with a sense of urgency; we treat each other with respect as though each day were our last.

Join EarlyBird Education where we are leveraging cutting-edge brain science, artificial intelligence and gamification to prevent reading struggles. Children play a game and we can identify whether they are at risk for reading difficulties, like dyslexia - even before they learn to read - and in the window when intervention re-wires the brain for reading success. With a mission to scale this to all children nationwide, EarlyBird is already in use in schools across the country with thousands of children. Join this fast growing, venture-funded team as we provide essential data, tools and resources to support educators, parents and pediatricians to change the learning trajectory of children nationwide.

As an Account Executive, and critical early employee of this startup company, you will play a major role in scaling this next-generation education technology. Weâ€™ll look to you to do what you do best; to bring fresh ideas to the table that can make our products, our work and our team better. This is your opportunity to play a key role in a company that is transforming the way young children learn.

Responsibilities

  • Qualify inbound leads and convert those leads into new partnerships
  • Craft and execute outbound strategy in partnership with EarlyBirdâ€™s instructional experts, and key opinion leaders in specific markets
  • Optimize sales process with Marketing, Sales Leader and Customer Success
  • Update CRM with learnings and pipeline projections

Skills and Experience

  • 1-4 years experience as a quota-carrying sales representative and/or sales closer experience in K-12 education (preferably SaaS and/or assessment)
  • Deep understanding of early literacy curriculum, instruction, and assessment as it pertains to the Science of Reading.
  • Ability to connect and build trust with school and district decision-makers
  • Ability to navigate complex early literacy conversations with enthusiasm, substance and nuance
  • Self-motivated with ability to work in fast paced, changing environment

What you will get out of this role

  • The chance to connect with educators around a really challenging, complex, and critical instructional problem in schools by scaling the reach of EarlyBird to tens of thousands of students.
  • A chance to build the growth engine of a research-driven education company from the ground up without compromising integrity, ambition, or fun.
  • A direct line to the product development team to share feedback from the field in order to make EarlyBird the strongest PreK-3 literacy platform in the market.
  • Become knowledgeable in early literacy instruction and dyslexia screening from some of the worldâ€™s foremost experts.
  • Contribute meaningfully to the culture of an inclusive, dynamic, and substantive growth team at a mission-driven education technology company.
  • Leadership opportunities to drive innovative approaches to pipeline development and positioning in the K-12 market.

Culture - We are building a team that brings a joyful urgency to this serious and critical work. We are science-driven and crave feedback. We assume best intentions and look for opportunities to lift our teammates up. We are transparent and humble with our customers while also being proud of the value and service we can provide them. Below are a few of the beliefs that we hold as a team and the type of person we think will do well on our team:

Beliefs

  • All children are capable of learning at a high level
  • Every child deserves access to evidence-based literacy instruction tailored to their needs
  • Educators deserve comprehensive literacy assessment data that is accessible and actionable.
  • Schools and districts need instructional and technology partners that build the tools and provide the support that are targeted and responsive to their feedback.
  • We have the team, technology, and focus to meaningfully change the trajectory of millions of childrenâ€™s lives.

Professional Traits

  • Organized and strong time management skills
  • Excellent writer; you enjoy crafting a message for a particular person and then revising that message over time as you look at the effectiveness of your initial attempt.
  • Self-aware and persuasive communicator; you make space for others to share their passion and expertise while knowing when you can contribute most to individual and group conversations.
  • A thirst for knowledge and growth in a mission-driven start-up; your skills and ambition could take you anywhere, but you are motivated each day by the fact that our solution helps teachers empower and liberate students from reading difficulties.
  • A sense of urgency and persistence; the window for intervention for millions of kids is now and you are driven to meet that moment for those children.
  • Flexible; we're a small company that moves and reacts fast when there is sufficient data and evidence to justify a change in direction.

Benefits

Benefits

  • Critical early member of a startup team
  • Competitive Compensation
  • Fun & Flexible Team
  • Unlimited vacation and flexible work hours
  • Excellent health and dental insurance
  • Paid parental leave
  • Home Office Setup Stipend
  • Remote team, with regular company gatherings
